form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenthal introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To prohibit the sale, lease, or loan of used motor vehicles with open recalls to consumers by auto dealers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Used Car Safety Recall Repair Act.

subsection.text: Section 30102(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking chapter— and inserting chapter:;

subparagraph.text: by inserting The term after the paragraph designation; and
by inserting a paragraph heading, the text of which is comprised of the term defined in the paragraph; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
The term used motor vehicle means a motor vehicle that has previously been purchased other than for resale.

subsection.header: Dealer reimbursement and limitation on the sale, lease, or loan of used motor vehicles
subsection.text: Section 30120 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as paragraphs (2) and (1), respectively, and moving the paragraphs so as to appear in numerical order;
in paragraph (2) (as so redesignated), in the paragraph heading, by striking In general and inserting Reimbursement for remedy provided; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Unavailable remedy for a used motor vehicle

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term dealer has the meaning given the term in subsection (l)(1).

clause.text: If a dealer is in possession of a used motor vehicle and the manufacturer of that used motor vehicle has failed to make a remedy available by the date described in clause (ii), the manufacturer shall reimburse the dealer at the rate described in clause (iii) until the earlier of—

subclause.text: the date on which a remedy is made available by the manufacturer; and
the date on which the total amount of payments to a dealer under this paragraph equals the fair market value of the used motor vehicle.

clause.text: The date referred to in clause (i) is the date that is 60 days after the date described in section 30119(b) and specified by the manufacturer—

subclause.text: in a notification under section 30119(a)(5); or

clause.text: The rate referred to in clause (i) is a rate determined by the Secretary that is not less than 1 percent of the fair market value of the used motor vehicle per month, which shall be prorated on a daily basis for each day that the used motor vehicle is in the possession of the dealer—

subclause.text: after the date described in clause (ii); and
before the date on which a remedy is made available by the manufacturer.

clause.text: The total amount of payments to a dealer under this paragraph with respect to a used motor vehicle shall not exceed the fair market value of that used motor vehicle.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Limitation on the sale, lease, or loan of used motor vehicles

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term dealer means a person that, during the 1-year period ending on the date of the sale, lease, or loan of a used motor vehicle, has sold at least 5 motor vehicles to buyers that in good faith purchased the vehicles other than for resale.

Except as provided under paragraph (3), a dealer shall not sell, lease, or loan a used motor vehicle until after any defect or noncompliance for which notification is required under subsection (b)(2)(A) or (c) of section 30118 with respect to the vehicle has been remedied.

subparagraph.text: the recall information regarding the used motor vehicle—

clause.text: was not available at the time of sale, lease, or loan using the means established by the Secretary under section 31301 of the Moving Ahead for Progress in the 21st Century Act (49 U.S.C. 30166 note; Public Law 112–141); and
was not available on the website of the manufacturer;

subparagraph.text: notification of the defect or noncompliance is required by an order issued by the Secretary under section 30118(b)(2), but enforcement of the order is set aside in a civil action to which section 30121(d) applies;
the used motor vehicle is sold at wholesale; or

clause.text: the used motor vehicle is a junk automobile (as defined in section 30501); and
all required information with respect to the used motor vehicle has been reported to the National Motor Vehicle Title Information System under section 30504.

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.
